definitions: continuing for a long time or remaining in existence
creating effects or impressions that endure permanently through time
examples: The medicine provides lasting relief from chronic pain
They formed lasting friendships during their college years
The war left lasting scars on the nation
Her speech made a lasting impression on everyone

definitions: present and capable of emerging but not yet visible or active
describing potential that exists but has not yet been realized
examples: The disease can remain latent for several years
Scientists discovered latent fingerprints at the crime scene
She recognized his latent talent for mathematics
The latent heat in the system was finally released

definitions: situated at or extending toward the side of something
moving or directed sideways rather than forward or backward
examples: The lateral walls of the building needed reinforcement
He suffered damage to the lateral ligaments
The quarterback made a lateral pass to his teammate
Lateral thinking helps solve complex problems creatively

definitions: happening or existing at the most recent point in time
representing the newest fashion, trend, or technological development available
examples: Have you heard the latest news about the election
The latest reports confirm our initial findings
She always wears the latest designer fashions
This phone has the latest technology and features

definitions: concerning or measured according to geographic latitude or distance from equator
examples: The latitudinal distribution of species varies with climate
Scientists study latitudinal gradients in biodiversity patterns

definitions: worthy of praise and commendation for good qualities or actions
examples: Her laudable efforts to help the homeless deserve recognition
The company's laudable commitment to sustainability impressed investors

definitions: containing or expressing praise and admiration for someone or something
examples: The critic wrote a laudatory review of the performance
His laudatory remarks about her work boosted morale

definitions: so absurd or inadequate as to be worthy of ridicule
causing laughter through humor or entertainment value deliberately
examples: Their laughable attempt at deception fooled no one
The price they're asking for that car is laughable
The comedian's laughable antics entertained the children
His laughable impression of the boss was spot-on

definitions: engaged in or showing the physical expression of laughter
having a bright, cheerful appearance suggestive of joy or laughter
examples: The laughing children played in the sunny garden
She couldn't stop her laughing fit during class
The laughing brook babbled through the forest
His laughing eyes revealed his true happiness

definitions: decorated with honors especially for achievement in arts or sciences
examples: The laureate poet read her newest work at the ceremony
Several laureate scientists attended the prestigious conference

definitions: having a pale purple color like that of lavender flowers
examples: She wore a beautiful lavender dress to the wedding
The lavender walls created a calming atmosphere

definitions: characterized by extravagant richness and profusion of decoration or provision
giving or bestowing something in generous or extravagant quantities
examples: The lavish party featured champagne and gourmet cuisine
They stayed in a lavish hotel overlooking the ocean
She was lavish with her praise for the team
His lavish spending habits eventually led to bankruptcy

definitions: allowed or recognized by law as legitimate and proper
examples: They conducted a lawful search with proper warrants
Citizens have the right to lawful assembly and protest

definitions: not governed by or obedient to laws characterized by lack of law
showing no respect for authority and behaving in a wild violent manner
examples: The lawless frontier towns lacked proper police forces
During the riots, the streets became lawless territories
The lawless gang terrorized the local community
His lawless behavior eventually led to his arrest

definitions: not sufficiently strict or severe lacking rigor or care
not taut or rigid having looseness in physical structure
examples: The school's lax discipline policy created problems
Security was surprisingly lax at the important event
The lax rope couldn't support much weight
Her lax muscles needed strengthening through exercise

definitions: having the effect of loosening or relaxing the bowels to relieve constipation
examples: The doctor prescribed a laxative medication for her condition
Prunes have natural laxative properties that aid digestion

definitions: not belonging to or having expertise in a particular profession
not belonging to the clergy relating to ordinary people rather than church
examples: The book explains complex science for lay readers
A lay person cannot perform this medical procedure
The lay members of the church organized the fundraiser
He serves as a lay minister in the congregation

definitions: arranged or structured in multiple distinct levels or strata
having multiple levels of meaning or complexity in structure or interpretation
examples: The layered cake had chocolate between each tier
She wore a layered outfit perfect for changing weather
The novel's layered narrative revealed new meanings on rereading
His layered personality made him hard to understand

definitions: unwilling to work or use energy showing lack of effort
moving slowly and gently without urgency or energetic activity
examples: The lazy student never completed his homework assignments
Don't be lazy; help with the household chores
We spent a lazy afternoon by the river
The lazy river wound through the peaceful valley

definitions: containing lead metal as a component especially in fuel or glass
examples: Leaded gasoline was phased out due to health concerns
The church windows featured beautiful leaded glass panels

definitions: having the heavy weight or dullness characteristic of lead metal
having a dull gray color resembling that of lead metal
oppressive or depressing in mood creating a feeling of heaviness
examples: His leaden limbs could barely move after the marathon
The leaden weight pressed down on the scale
The leaden sky threatened rain all afternoon
Pollution gave the water a leaden appearance
A leaden silence fell over the funeral gathering
The news left him with a leaden feeling

definitions: most important or influential in a particular field or activity
positioned at the front or ahead of others in space or ranking
examples: She's a leading expert in climate science research
The leading cause of accidents is distracted driving
The leading runner maintained a steady pace
The leading edge of technology drives innovation forward

definitions: having leaves or foliage of a specified type or number
examples: The four-leafed clover is considered a lucky symbol
Broad-leafed plants dominated the tropical garden landscape

definitions: having no leaves either naturally or due to seasonal shedding
examples: The leafless trees stood stark against the winter sky
Disease left the orchard completely leafless and barren

definitions: having many leaves or abundant foliage creating shade or coverage
consisting of or containing edible leaves especially green vegetables
examples: The leafy trees provided welcome shade from summer heat
We walked through a leafy suburban neighborhood
She prepared a healthy salad with leafy greens
Leafy vegetables are rich in essential vitamins

definitions: allowing liquid or gas to escape through holes or cracks
examples: The leaky roof needed immediate repair before winter
A leaky faucet wastes hundreds of gallons yearly

definitions: having little excess fat or flesh on the body
containing little or no fat as a food product
efficient and without waste especially in business operations
examples: The athlete maintained a lean, muscular physique
Wild animals tend to be leaner than domesticated ones
Choose lean cuts of meat for healthier meals
The lean turkey burger was surprisingly flavorful
The company adopted lean manufacturing principles
They run a lean operation with minimal overhead

definitions: inclined or tilted away from a vertical or perpendicular position
examples: The famous Leaning Tower of Pisa attracts millions of tourists
The old leaning fence finally collapsed during the storm

definitions: having acquired much knowledge through study showing deep education
acquired or developed through experience education or training
examples: The learned professor published numerous scholarly articles
She sought advice from learned colleagues
Public speaking is a learned skill requiring practice
His learned behavior came from years of observation

definitions: held or occupied under a legal lease agreement for specified terms
examples: They moved into a leased apartment downtown
The company operates from leased office space

definitions: having a tough flexible texture resembling leather in appearance or feel
examples: Years of sun exposure gave him leathery skin
The leathery leaves help the plant conserve water

definitions: bearing or characterized by leaves of a particular kind or number
examples: The broad-leaved forest provided dense shade coverage
Three-leaved plants are common in this region

definitions: made light and porous by fermentation with yeast or chemical agents
examples: Leavened bread has a lighter texture than flatbread
Most Western breads are leavened with commercial yeast

definitions: showing excessive or offensive sexual desire in an unpleasant way
examples: His lecherous behavior made everyone uncomfortable at work
The lecherous old man was banned from the library

definitions: situated on the side sheltered from wind or weather
examples: The sailors anchored on the lee side of the island
We pitched our tent in a lee position

definitions: situated on or moving toward the side sheltered from the wind
examples: The leeward side of the mountain receives less rainfall
Ships drifted toward the leeward shore during storms

definitions: on or toward the side of the body where the heart is
remaining after others have gone or been used or dealt with
favoring liberal, socialist, or radical political views and reforms
examples: Turn left at the next traffic light
She writes with her left hand
Only three cookies were left in the jar
The left money should cover our expenses
The left wing of the party advocates for healthcare reform
His left politics alienated conservative voters

definitions: supporting or relating to left-wing socialist or radical political views
examples: The leftist candidate promised universal healthcare coverage
Leftist movements gained momentum during the economic crisis

definitions: situated at the farthest point to the left in position
examples: Click the leftmost button to return home
The leftmost column contains the most important data

definitions: remaining and not used or consumed from a larger amount
examples: We ate leftover pizza for breakfast this morning
She used leftover fabric to make decorative pillows

definitions: relating to the law or the administration of justice
permitted or required by law conforming to legal requirements
examples: She sought legal advice before signing the contract
The legal system protects citizens' fundamental rights
Is it legal to park here after midnight
They took legal action against the company

definitions: performed in a smooth flowing manner without breaks between notes
examples: The pianist played the melody with beautiful legato phrasing
Practice these legato passages slowly at first

definitions: remarkably famous and celebrated often for a particular quality
described in or based on legends rather than historical fact
examples: Her legendary generosity helped thousands of students
The legendary musician influenced generations of artists
Dragons are legendary creatures found in many cultures
The legendary King Arthur may have been real

definitions: having legs of a specified kind number or condition
examples: The three-legged stool wobbled on uneven ground
Long-legged birds wade through shallow marshes easily

definitions: clear enough to be read easily especially of handwriting or print
examples: Please write in legible handwriting on the form
The ancient manuscript was barely legible after centuries

definitions: great in number constituting or amounting to a large indefinite number
examples: Her fans are legion across the entire world
The problems facing the company were legion

definitions: having the power to make laws or relating to law-making
examples: The legislative branch passes bills into law
Legislative reforms addressed the housing crisis effectively

definitions: conforming to law or rules being exactly as intended
able to be defended with logic or justification reasonable and valid
examples: The court ruled it was a legitimate business transaction
She is the legitimate heir to the fortune
He had legitimate concerns about the project's safety
That's a legitimate question worth discussing

definitions: having no legs either naturally or through loss or amputation
examples: Snakes are legless reptiles that move by slithering
The legless veteran competed in Paralympic swimming events

definitions: acting or done at leisure without haste in a relaxed manner
examples: They enjoyed a leisurely breakfast on the terrace
We took a leisurely stroll through the park
